content.raw:
I did a couple of quick tests and verified that the cylinder geometry does have an adverse effect on computational needs.  I also verified that running the test with 100 of the spherical buoys \(that use the sphere buoyancy geometry\) is much more efficient - back to RTF of 1.0.

I would recommend that we use a spherical geometry within the buoyancy plugin for our buoys - the surmark models and the colored totems.   I believe this will provide an imperceptible difference in fidelity for the case of the buoys without the computational cost.  

We’ll reserve use of the other geometries \(box and cylinder\) for situations where capturing the higher fidelity physical interactions is warranted.
content.html:
I did a couple of quick tests and verified that the cylinder geometry does have an adverse effect on computational needs. I also verified that running the test with 100 of the spherical buoys (that use the sphere buoyancy geometry) is much more efficient - back to RTF of 1.0.

I would recommend that we use a spherical geometry within the buoyancy plugin for our buoys - the surmark models and the colored totems. I believe this will provide an imperceptible difference in fidelity for the case of the buoys without the computational cost.

We’ll reserve use of the other geometries (box and cylinder) for situations where capturing the higher fidelity physical interactions is warranted.
